questionTitle: 1. The leaves and stems of the alfalfa plant are the only parts of the plant ___.
anwers: they are used for livestock feed

questionTitle: A fuel is a substance used ___ light, heat, or energy.
Closed plane figures like the square or the equilateral triangle can be grouped into a class __________polygons.
The extent of the harmful effect of locoweeds on animals depends on the soil ___the plants grow.
___ reaches the cells of the body, it is oxidized, or slowly burned
It has been estimated that ________ one hundred thousand men participated in the gold rush of 1898.
________ the lip of an open-pit copper mine, the huge tractors and cranes below look like toys, and people look like tiny ants scurrying about.
________ born, a baby kangaroo measures less than three inches in length.
The bank manager advised him ________ his savings into a time deposit account.
A good student must know________
anwers: the way of efficiency in study

questionTitle: Poison oak generates irritating poisons ________ even if people merely brush against the plants.
It is generally believed that an M.B.A degree is good preparation for a career in ________.
California relies heavily on income from fruit crops, and ________.
In practice, setting up a chain of command in a business can be a very complicated task, ________ it involves the interaction of real human beings.
The Appaloosa horse was brought to Mexico from Spain, was later 0introduced into the United States, and today ________.
By declining to run for presidential reelection in 1808, Thomas Jefferson ________ the two-term tradition still followed, with but a few exceptions, to the present day.
As a safety measure, the detonator for a nuclear device may be made of ________ each of which is controlled by a different employee.
This part of the country seldom ________ such hot weather.
Most accidents in the home can be prevented by ________ elimination of hazards.
Technically, glass is a mineral and ________.
